title: Indicate when an item or impl depends on a feature

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-dev-tools
labels.description: Relevant to the dev-tools subteam, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Crates that have features often cause confusion. For example, the Diesel documentation shows that there exists an `impl` for specific trait+type combination: (in this case DB=Pg, short for PostgreSQL)
(from [Diesel documentation](http://docs.diesel.rs/diesel/types/trait.FromSqlRow.html))

```
impl<DB> FromSqlRow<Timestamptz, DB> for DateTime<UTC> where
    DB: Backend + HasSqlType<Timestamptz>,
    DateTime<UTC>: FromSql<Timestamptz, DB>
```

and again:

```
impl FromSql<Timestamptz, Pg> for DateTime<UTC>
impl Backend for Pg
impl HasSqlType<Timestamptz> for Pg
```

Yet it fails on compilation:

> error[E0277]: the trait bound `chrono::datetime::DateTime<chrono::offset::utc::UTC>: diesel::types::FromSqlRow<diesel::types::Timestamptz, _>` is not satisfied

The problem here is that `FromSql<Timestamptz, Pg> for DateTime<UTC>` and thus also `FromSqlRow<Timestamptz, DB> for DateTime<UTC>` are implemented only when the feature `"chrono"` is enabled. But the [docs of FromSql](http://docs.diesel.rs/diesel/types/trait.FromSql.html) and [FromSqlRow](http://docs.diesel.rs/diesel/types/trait.FromSqlRow.html) don't indicate this at all.

This problem is mentioned elsewhere too: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/18701 (however, that issue is about the manually written doc comments on impls). Features seem to stump and baffle users.

I think that Rustdoc should clearly indicate, when an impl, or a type, trait or module, for that matter, is available only when a certain feature is enabled. That would at make the features discoverable, which they currently often aren't.
